intro: Hieracium gjevilense, commonly known as the Gjevilënska hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium gjevilense is noted for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments.
